channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What's it like to report from the Panama Canal?
item.description: A team from NPR's All Things Considered went to Panama to report on the canal there, which has gained attention in recent months due to President Trump's comments about the U.S. taking control of it.
item.content:encoded: A team from NPR's All Things Considered went to Panama to report on the canal there, which has gained attention in recent months due to President Trump's comments about the U.S. taking control of it.
item.dc:creator: Noah Caldwell

item.title: Amazon workers vote against unionizing a North Carolina warehouse
item.description: Workers voted against joining a grassroots union called Carolina Amazonians United for Solidarity and Empowerment, or CAUSE.
item.content:encoded:
Workers voted against joining a grassroots union called Carolina Amazonians United for Solidarity and Empowerment, or CAUSE.

(Image credit: Scott Sharpe)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: German chancellor slams Vance's call for Europe to be inclusive of far-right parties
item.description: Olaf Scholz rebuked U.S. Vice President JD Vance for suggesting that far-right parties should not be shut out of government. Germany's other political parties have refused to work with the far-right AfD.
item.content:encoded:
Olaf Scholz rebuked U.S. Vice President JD Vance for suggesting that far-right parties should not be shut out of government. Germany's other political parties have refused to work with the far-right AfD.

(Image credit: Sean Gallup)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Doctors order 'absolute rest' for Pope Francis due to respiratory infection
item.description: Doctors prescribed "absolute rest" for Pope Francis, the Vatican said Saturday, a day after the 88-year-old pope was admitted to a hospital following a weeklong bout of bronchitis.
item.content:encoded:
Doctors prescribed "absolute rest" for Pope Francis, the Vatican said Saturday, a day after the 88-year-old pope was admitted to a hospital following a weeklong bout of bronchitis.

(Image credit: Alessandra Tarantino)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: EEOC seeks to drop gender discrimination case after Trump executive order
item.description: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission moved to drop a suit on behalf of a worker allegedly fired for his sexual orientation and gender identity, arguing the case conflicts with President Trump's executive order.
item.content:encoded:
The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission moved to drop a suit on behalf of a worker allegedly fired for his sexual orientation and gender identity, arguing the case conflicts with President Trump's executive order.

(Image credit: Lindsey Wasson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Woman drops suit accusing Sean 'Diddy' Combs and Jay-Z of raping her when she was 13
item.description: The suit was initially filed in October, claiming that the woman was lured by a limousine driver outside the 2000 MTV Video Music Awards and assaulted by the two rappers at an after-party.
item.content:encoded:
The Book Of Clarence at the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures on Jan. 5, 2024.'/>

The suit was initially filed in October, claiming that the woman was lured by a limousine driver outside the 2000 MTV Video Music Awards and assaulted by the two rappers at an after-party.

(Image credit: Monica Schipper)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Tennis' top-ranked Jannik Sinner gets a 3-month ban in doping case settlement
item.description: Sinner accepted the ban in a settlement with the World Anti-Doping Agency. The timing of the ban means the 23-year-old Italian won't miss any Grand Slam tournaments.
item.content:encoded:
Sinner accepted the ban in a settlement with the World Anti-Doping Agency. The timing of the ban means the 23-year-old Italian won't miss any Grand Slam tournaments.

(Image credit: Asanka Brendon Ratnayake)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Give me the head!' Neuroscientist inspires whale and dolphin research in Brazil
item.description: Time is of the essence for a Brazilian neuroscientist who wants to study whale and dolphin brains before the brains decompose in the heat.
item.content:encoded:
Time is of the essence for a Brazilian neuroscientist who wants to study whale and dolphin brains before the brains decompose in the heat.

(Image credit: Instituto Baleia Jubarte)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Prize-winning pictures: Images from this photo contest show tech changing the world
item.description: The website restofworld got entries from 45 countries for a photo contest focusing on technology. Here are their top picks -- from facial scans for migrants to kids in a Mongolian tent transfixed by of a TV.
item.content:encoded:
The website restofworld got entries from 45 countries for a photo contest focusing on technology. Here are their top picks -- from facial scans for migrants to kids in a Mongolian tent transfixed by of a TV.

(Image credit: Grace Yoon)
item.dc:creator: Vicky Hallett

item.title: A 2nd U.S. judge pauses Trump's order against gender-affirming care for trans youth
item.description: A second federal judge paused President Trump's executive order halting federal support for gender-affirming care for transgender youth under 19.
item.content:encoded:
A second federal judge paused President Trump's executive order halting federal support for gender-affirming care for transgender youth under 19.

(Image credit: Manuel Valdes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
